newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares close higher, but Kvaerner falls.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares close higher, but Kvaerner falls.

text.p: Shares in Kvaerner ASA plunged to help burden the Oslo Bourse Total index on Tuesday after the Anglo-Norwegian construction and engineering company released disappointing first-half results.
The Total index closed 1.08 percent up at 1,285.20 points in heavy turnover of 1.6 billion crowns to shadow a European trend following a rebound on Wall Street.
Kvaerner's A share alone accounted for 408 million crowns and was the most traded share of the session. The share tumbled 5.8 percent, or 27 crowns, to 431 crowns.
The stock was 10 crowns up when the results were announced.
"The figures were extremely bad and show a pre-tax margin for the first and second quarter of less than one percent," said an Oslo-based analyst.
The London-headquartered company posted pre-tax profits up 19 percent at 840 million crowns in the first half.
The results fell well below expectations.
Industrial group Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, helped pull up the Total index by closing 13 crowns, or 2.91 percent, higher at 408 crowns.
